subject: Re: [junit] Capture Image in HtmlUnit
msgSnippet: ... You can find HTML elements by any arbitrary attribute, including the src attribute for the HtmlImage tag. I don t remember the exact API call, but it s
messageBody:
saldin samuel wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am working on HTMLUnit. I am able to capture almost
> all the elements but struck up with Image.
>
> I have the following HTML script where I have the
> image with source but without Id or Name attributes.
>
> ......
> <a href="#" onclick="return false"><img
> src="/em/cabo/images/cache/en/bStopDwKu.gif"
> border="0" align="middle" width="44" height="18"></a>
> ......
>
> It would be great if anyone can tell me how to capture
> the image as HtmlImage for the above script which does
> not have Id or Name attribute.

You can find HTML elements by any arbitrary attribute, including the
"src" attribute for the HtmlImage tag. I don't remember the exact API
call, but it's there.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
